attributes.action: Honour Lloyd Gardner in recognition of his selfless act of donating his £10,000 reward for assisting the police to the victim of the crime.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This is an incredible act of selflessness by a 22 year old who is an example to us all.  Not only did he come forward and assist the police but he has now decided to give his £10,000 reward the victim of the attack.  Too often we complain about our young people, this incredible act should be recognised by the awarding of an honour.

Lloyd Gardner, a 22 year old waiter from Devon, responded to a police appeal for assistance in identifying a man wanted in connection with a rape. The attacker was duly arrested and convicted of rape and causing grievous bodily harm.  Mr Gardner received a £10,000 reward for providing the information with brought about the arrest of the offender.  

There is no doubt that most people, especially (we assume) a young person on a low income, would have kept the reward money and would rightly be entitled to do so.

To his great credit Mr Gardner has decided to donate his £10,000 reward to the victim of the offence.  The victim suffered a fractured skull and brain damage in the attack and her injuries were so severe that she now uses a wheelchair.

We commend the actions of Lloyd Gardner and respectfully request that he receives suitable recognition for his galant actions.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.direct.gov.uk/honours
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
